Reviews.Title: “Reliable and Close to Airport - Noisy at the End of the Runway”
Reviews.Author: zanezed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on my way to CTG out of MIA. This Courtyard Marriott is typical of most Marriott middle range hotels. It's very clean and the staff are helpful and professional. The hotel is not Marriott's most contemporary design, but my room was functional with a flat screen TV and free wireless internet. and a balcony. The desk offered me a small welcome gift of bottled water and chocolate as I am a Marriott rewards member - basically nothing but it was nice. The front desk also helped me order in food from Doral pizza which was not bad. The shuttle service runs on a schedule to and from MIA about hourly - I called anyway when I arrived. I used the Whirlpool which was nice, and the gym which is super super small but has two treadmills, a bench with free weights to 50lbs and a bike. I did not get to use the pool because the staff were cleaning it at the time - it looked very nice. The one thing about this hotel is it's location to the runway... its almost hilarious how loud and close the aircraft come to the hotel when landing... I was going to ask for another room from the front desk however in the elevator on the way down I could still hear the aircraft screaming overhead. I did get a good sleep though so it was not such a big deal after all... if you or your kids are aeroplane buffs then this might be a cool place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kdsolomon
Reviews.Content: This courtyard was very convenient to find from the airport. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I did find it hard to find any late night restaurants, other than Denny's, without having to drive miles away. Other than that I enjoyed my stay at this location and was very pleased. The rooms were equipped with wifi and that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good,Too Far Away, Maintenance Issues”
Reviews.Author: AskDrReg
Reviews.Content: Not a very good stay at this property! The downsides for me were many. The location of the property is very difficult to find and when you do find it, it is difficult to get to it. The location is costly because there are tolls associated with getting to it, if you don't know the none toll road way to get to it. I was fortunate that I lived in Miami for three years and knew the roadways very well. The fact that this property does not include any continental breakfast shocked me. There is a deli and coffee shop inside with plenty of seating. But the prices for food and drinks were a little high for my liking. One would think that since the property was far off the beaten path the management would offer some form of discount or reduce costs for patrons. As far as other issues with this property, the jacuzzi was not hot at all. It was mostly luke warm at best. The elevator was broken 2 of the 4 days I stayed. The maintenance of the building is lacking. The bright spot of the stay was the people at the front desk. They were very responsive to all issues but was unable to get them fixed. I guess the maintenance department needs new help. I probably will not stay at this property again or recommended it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Creatto
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate for this hotel (around 90 dollars per night) so it was hard to resist even after reading all the reviews on this site, I still put my trust on the fact that is a Marriott and I am very glad I did. My experience in this hotel was good, and I didn't give it 5 points just because I do believe they should updgrade the floors and carpets in the rooms and add a little more "wow" factor to the decoration, having said this, the rest of my experience for the 5 nights I stayed was pretty good. These are my observations: 1. The lobby and front area of the hotel is inviting, nicely decorated and has a lot of nice functional spaces to hold meetings with colleagues or other guests. 2. There is a station that has access to coffee to go and water with lime on that area that I found super convenient. 3. Most of the staff (not everyone) were friendly and helpful 4. The courtyard with the swimming pool was actually really nice and enjoyable both, at day or at night. 5. The rooms were really spacious and the beds are very comfortable. 6. The furniture on the rooms is actually really nice (except for the dated sofa) but there is a large HD TV and it is well layed out. 7. Closet space and drawer space are enough and convenient. 8. For me, Internet connectivity is really important, and this hotel had one of the best I have seen in a hotel so far, it was fast and simple. 9. Even when I got a room on the first floor due to my rate, the rooms were reasonably quiet (this is an airport hotel) On the not so great side of things: 1. The carpets need to go or to be changed 2. The decoration in some areas needs to be re-vamped. 3. The excercise room wasnt all that great 4. The breakfast buffett wasn't all that great, so, I ended up just once and went to Denny's (1 minute drive from the hotel) for Breakfast the rest of my time. So, in the end a pleasant experience, and it definitely surprased my initial expectations and I would recommend, specially when it helped me save over half of my bill. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTvlr
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to stay at this hotel based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor, but were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. We were two adults and two children. We stayed the night before and after our trip. There is a 24 hour guard at the gated entrance to their fenced and well lit parking lot, and we saved a bunch of money on parking. They have a free shuttle to and from the Miami Airport. As others have said, this Courtyard does not have the remodel that other Courtyards have. However, it has everything that you and your family could need. Breakfast buffet was outstanding and even included made to order eggs/ omelets for only $10 adult and $5 children. They have a free coffee station and also free computers to use in the lobby. The pool was clean and large for a Courtyard and had many lounge chairs to use. Our room was dated, but was clean and roomy. We had two queens in one room and a pull out sofa in the other room. Flat screen TVs, microwave, and mini-fridge were nice touches. The hotel staff were very nice and very helpful!! Ask them for the handout that lists all the nearby restaurants and attractions. Doral is one of the nicest areas of Miami, but you will need a car to get to most places. However, there are a few restaurants that you can easily walk to. Overall, we were pleased with this hotel. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when flying out of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have a rental”
Reviews.Author: truthFULLUsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with one of my girlfriends to celebrate her birthday. This is a decent hotel. It is away from the SoBe action. We had a rental car so it was no problem for us girls. We drove to SoBe and had a great time and saved some $$$. The airport shuttle was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Towels at Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Vinay0725
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Close to Airport 2. Complimentary Shuttle 3. Helpful Staff Cons: 1. Found Dirty Towels in the Bathroom 2. Old / Unclean Carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Shas1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in need of a renovation. Location is great if you are catching a flight. Shuttle service to the airport. We called several times for directions and were given different directions each time. They seemed totally clueless. I agree that I wouldn't want to stay here for more than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajmartinezp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, the area is cozy and the hotel staff is friendly, I checked in and my room had a broken safety deposit box, I called the front desk and they send someone to fix it and it only took approximately 45 min from the moment I called until it was fixed. The staff speaks English and Spanish but do respect the language you use when addressing to them, even though you might look Hispanic they will reply to you in English if thatâ€™s how you address to them. The noise is OK but you can hear the planes passing by, specially the big ones, so if you are looking for a quiet hotel this one is not your best choice, if you are looking for a place to stay and sleep and are not bothered by the noise then stay here. Be sure not to select the rate with breakfast included unless you are OK eating the same thing every day. Their menu is the same so donâ€™t expect lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: madubo
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect too much based on the area and approach to the hotel. It was absolutely adequate and very clean. The business office was very acessible and had enough computers for all to use. Very helpful desk clerks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and quiet although its nearby a highway.”
Reviews.Author: Maricar19
Reviews.Content: Good service, spacious and clean room, very clean pool and helpful employees. I enjoyed chatting with the shuttle driver in my way to the airport. I't was a nice stay. I'll be back whenever need to go to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly up to Courtyard standards”
Reviews.Author: JAYTRAVEL1958
Reviews.Content: The property is in a dismal area, and situated ( the entrance ) in an alleyway. The decor is somewhat dated and my room looked like a spruced up Days Inn room. To be fair , it was clean and had the basic ammenities. The whirlpool ( a pleasant surprise that they had one) was clean as was the pool and gazeebo. The front desk was gracious but under staffed. The ice machine was out of order upon arrival and reported. I was then told to go to the other floors , the ice machines are in the same postion. While this might be ok for a few hours .....to be out all weekend is totally unacceptable.The Latin American Grill was recommeded for " quick " Cuban food and did not disappoint or cause a gastonomic nightmare. By the Shell station acroos the street there are other offerings. Ask for a room facing the rental car parking lot, the other alternative is to listen to the constant drone of the highway. The hotel is on the glidedlope of Miami International so be prepared for the occasional MD88 screaming in for a landing. A quick pit stop at best.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AustinBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the other reviews, we decided to stay here because of the location next to the airport. The hotel itself is fine. It's clean, neat, rooms have been updated and the beds comfortable. Flat screen tv. However, it's right in the path of the airport landing, so it can get loud, although the only thing we heard in the room was the people at the pool until 2am. I would not get a courtyard view room in the summer. One other thing that could have been a disaster was that they failed to give us a wake up call despite being on the list (I double checked in the morning). Fortunately I woke up in time. So overall, it is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULDN'T COME BACK HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: CelineT1
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on the 28th late evening. Called hotel for clarification on directions, only to speak to a rude staff member. It only got better from there. The hotel had a stale pungent odor, strange people wandering the halls. The room was clean, but worn. Beds were comfortable, the only good thing during our stay. The neighbors door slammed all throughout the night and we heard all of their conversations. Not to mention, we had staff members walk into our room unannounced twice...no knock or noise..quite shocking. We ended up moving to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come to this place”
Reviews.Author: noldish
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for: - Poor lit, smelly corridors. - Stained walls and carpets. - Noisy rooms. - Slow internet connection in room, not wireless (43.37 kbps - measured) - Rude customer service at front desk. - No security. - Unreliable airport shuttle. The only Marriot with a shuttle you have to call first if you want to be picked up at the airport. - A big flat screen HD TV in your room to distract you from all the above. Do you watch TV? Should you ever decide to stay at this place I would highly recommend renting a car. Cabs in Miami can make your visit a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed here for an overnight stay. First off, I did not hear any noise even though the airport is nearby. The beds were pretty comfortable and are good for a good nights rest. The rooms are ok, not like the newer Courtyard hotels. It did have a big flat screen TV. But some parts of the room looked a bit dated. Some of the desk agents were not wearing name tags which is a Marriott standard. The hotel itself is ok and I would stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel: safe, clean, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Courtyard continues to be a well thought out business hotel. Switches are in the right place, plenty of outlets for computer and phone charger, no surprises. That's fine by me. The exercise room is tiny. The pool is small too. The decor is uninspiring. But the people are nice, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. I checked in easily, did my business, slept, and checked out without a care. For me, a business hotel is like a baseball umpire, the less I notice it the better. I barely noticed this room, and that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel, will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: paristravels1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the two in the direct area, it is in a convenient location, the staff are fairly helpful, and friendly. Very clean room, and convenient for smokers, although it is advertised as a "smoke-free" hotel, we had no problem smoking out the door on the first floor, or balcony's on other levels, i'm pretty sure every room is equipped with a door or balcony. Room service was prompt, and friendly. I slept like a baby both nights, there is some noise because of the airport being so close, but the room was pretty much sound proof, and we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “The single worst Marriott property in Miami”
Reviews.Author: monami_nyc
Reviews.Content: With Doral being such a growing hub for business, I was astounded at how "un" Marriott the Courtyard Marriott in Doral is. From the lack of attentiveness and service at the front desk, poor on-site facilities (the fitness center is a joke and must be seen as no words could convey how much of a joke it is), ridiculously slow internet connection (provided by a telco in Wichita, KS), and dated decor, this a serious blotch on an otherwise strong Marriott brand. As a loyal Marriott Rewards members, this is one of the few times I would sacrifice points and choose an alternative brand. Avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Opt for a nicer place if its on your company dime”
Reviews.Author: MeganG2
Reviews.Content: Definitely overpriced for what you get. I understand that Miami is a humid place, but there is no reason that the hallways (which are completely enclosed) should be without air conditioning! The room itself was fine other than the fact that it was obviously a smoking room before the hotel became nonsmoking. Other than that it was what you would expect from a courtyard. If your rate says that it includes breakfast, they still make you sign a slip of paper saying that it is $10. I crossed the amount out and never was charged, but be careful. It was a little strange. Front desk staff were helpful though, and there was free internet and a great business center.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 8 quality for Marriot Price”
Reviews.Author: Salesguyy2k
Reviews.Content: Friendly associates. Pillows are nice, room below standards, and TV, oh the TV: Old style, tv that was so dark in image that you could barely see the screen, with no ability to change controls to brighten up.Complained, with no results or offer of another room. Oh and besure to ask for a room way ahead of time that over looks the courtyard, otherwise you get a room like mine that over loks the Pepsi semi distributors parking lot, which runs ALL NIGHT LONG. ASk for an extra coffee pack if two people in room, otherwise you split a small cup.For the price, find something bettter...TRUST ME!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: alohalady1
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close the the airport for a very early flight in the a.m. This is perfect for this reason . Free shuttle starting at 5 a.m to the airport,free access to computer area in the lobby as well as free access from room.Breakfast only served but mini mart snacks available in lobby plus a microwave.Quiet ,comfortable rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Pass this Courtyard up for a better one”
Reviews.Author: Carlyelvis
Reviews.Content: Checked in one night and checked out the next morning, cancelling the next 4 days I was supposed to stay here. Neighborhood is "security-challenged" and we didn't feel safe at all. Parking lot w/lots of trees, shrubs, poor lighting. Our room reeked of mold and mildew. Breakfast only fair. Overall, this place is older, and in need of some spiffing up. Pass this one up; there are better places to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for One Night”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is like any other Courtyard; basically good and comfortable. With that having been said, I really don't think I'd stay here again. We booked for the night before a cruise and decided to rent a car to make dinner, breakfast (which is not included) and lunch easier as well as to prevent having to be bound by the shuttle schedule to the cruise port - the shuttle is not free, by the way, although it is available as part of a special package and winds up costing about $20 per room. It took us a solid 30 minutes to find the hotel, and that is with printed directions. Even when we got into the parking lot, we could not tell if we were at the proper hotel since there is another Marriott sharing the grounds and the Courtyard has no external signs whatsoever, save for the mat in front of the door. My daughter actually had to get out of the car and walk to the entrance to verify that we were at the Courtyard. The sign facing the road is miniscule and back from the street so it is very hard to spot at night. As another review noted, there is a 24/7 guard in the lot. Well, when I watched the morning news, I found that there had been a police action with a person shot virtually outside the hotel during the night...and they told me I could walk to nearby restaurants! To be fair, the neighborhood's problems can't be blamed on the hotel, but I cannot see myself staying in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pre-Cruise Choice”
Reviews.Author: kstvlagnt
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise the next day. The hotel has free shuttle service to the property and one can purchase their "cruise" package which will prepay a shuttle to the pier the next day. It all worked very smoothly. The hotel has several restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Be on your guard at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: 7MileBeach
Reviews.Content: I picked the title for my review for 2 reasons. The good reason was that there actually is a guard at the front gate that you have to pass in order to drive in. The bad reason was that the side entrance to the hotel's door was broken and unlocked all night (you are supposed to swipe your card to enter). There were a few sketching people hanging out in the parking lot also but they were probably just guests. We picked this hotel for a shopping-Miami trip and the location was perfect for that. It is pretty central to the major shopping centres. It is about a 30min drive from Miami Beach so if you're looking for nightlife this is not the place to stay. Our room was clean but it was right next to a generator which was a bit noisy. The best part of our stay was the breakfast in the morning. It was a great selection and the staff was very friendly. I will not stay here again though on my next visit because there are many other hotels nearby to try.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for travellers, not ideal for tourists”
Reviews.Author: SimonPDurham
Reviews.Content: The setting is convenient for the airport and there is a regular shuttle service. On the downside its miles from anywhere so you definately need a car. The staff are friendly enough and the public areas are good. The rooms are big, clean and the beds are fantastic, free internet access too. The 'restaurant' only opens for breakfast and theres no bar so evening meals will be walking or driving - or you can get something from the 'Market' which is a small fridge next to reception with a couple of sandwiches in it. Would I stay again? As a tourist no, as a one nighter before going to the airport the next day, yes. Note this is a 100% no smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: spunkster
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Recently renovated. Staff nice. Nice business area. Restaurant onsite. Rather hard to find from Miami Airport - lots of road construction making finding hotel difficult if driving.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Thetripcolony
Reviews.Content: Hotel shuttles to and from MIA are slow and unreliable. Staff is not helpful, many do not speak English. Hotel is located in a bad neighborhood. I would not stay here again, one of the worst Courtyard experiences I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: cwaters
Reviews.Content: Stayed there August 2004. Lowest bed I have ever seen. Mattress was quite thin. Buffet breakfast - eggs were runny, service was slow (to get my bill!). Hot tub was great.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Miami Airport West/Doral
HotelInfo.Address: 3929 Northwest 79th Avenue, Miami, FL 33166
